biogeographicRealms.name: Palearctic
biogeographicRealms.description: Europe, North Africa, most of Asia

indigenousTerritories.name: Yokuts
indigenousTerritories.description: The Yokuts people traditionally managed valley grasslands through controlled burns and sustainable hunting practices.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Seasonal burning cycles maintained oak savannas and prevented large wildfires.

indigenousTerritories.name: Miwok
indigenousTerritories.description: Northern valley tribes who practiced sophisticated ecological management including acorn processing and wetland stewardship.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Developed complex food systems utilizing over 500 native plant species.

indigenousTerritories.name: Kayapo
indigenousTerritories.description: One of the largest indigenous groups maintaining traditional forest management practices across 28 territories.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Forest islands creation, fire management, and biodiversity enhancement through traditional farming.

indigenousTerritories.name: Yanomami
indigenousTerritories.description: Largest indigenous territory in Brazil, maintaining traditional rainforest lifestyle and serving as biodiversity guardians.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Sustainable hunting rotations, medicinal plant cultivation, and forest succession management.

indigenousTerritories.name: Tikuna
indigenousTerritories.description: Riverine peoples with extensive knowledge of aquatic ecosystems and floodplain management.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Fish farming in natural lakes, flood cycle agriculture, and riparian forest conservation.

indigenousTerritories.name: Tuareg
indigenousTerritories.description: Nomadic Berber people with centuries of desert navigation and resource management knowledge.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Water source identification, seasonal migration routes, and drought-resistant animal husbandry.

indigenousTerritories.name: Toubou
indigenousTerritories.description: Desert dwellers of the central Sahara with expertise in extreme environment survival.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Date palm cultivation, salt trade routes, and desert weather prediction.

indigenousTerritories.name: Traditional Owners (70+ groups)
indigenousTerritories.description: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples with 60,000+ years of reef stewardship.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Seasonal fishing calendars, sea country management, and coral spawning predictions.

indigenousTerritories.name: Yirrganydji
indigenousTerritories.description: Traditional owners of the Port Douglas region with extensive marine knowledge.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Sustainable fishing practices, turtle nesting protection, and reef restoration techniques.

indigenousTerritories.name: Ba'Aka (Pygmy peoples)
indigenousTerritories.description: Forest-dependent peoples with intimate knowledge of Central African rainforests.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Non-timber forest product harvesting, animal behavior tracking, and forest navigation.

indigenousTerritories.name: Baka
indigenousTerritories.description: Hunter-gatherer communities maintaining traditional forest lifestyle in Cameroon and Central African Republic.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Medicinal plant identification, sustainable hunting techniques, and forest regeneration practices.

indigenousTerritories.name: Sherpa
indigenousTerritories.description: High-altitude peoples of the Everest region with expertise in mountain ecosystem management.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Alpine agriculture, yak husbandry, and high-altitude forest conservation.

indigenousTerritories.name: Gurung
indigenousTerritories.description: Mountain communities practicing traditional agro-pastoralism and forest stewardship.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Terraced farming, community forest management, and medicinal plant cultivation.

indigenousTerritories.name: Tibetan peoples
indigenousTerritories.description: Plateau dwellers with traditional knowledge of high-altitude ecosystem management.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Cordyceps harvesting, grazing rotation systems, and sacred grove protection.

indigenousTerritories.name: Inuit
indigenousTerritories.description: Arctic peoples with millennia of experience in polar ecosystem management and climate observation.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Sea ice prediction, wildlife migration tracking, and sustainable marine mammal hunting.

indigenousTerritories.name: Sami
indigenousTerritories.description: Indigenous reindeer herders of northern Scandinavia and Russia with traditional tundra management practices.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Reindeer husbandry, lichen management, and seasonal migration coordination.

indigenousTerritories.name: Nenets
indigenousTerritories.description: Nomadic reindeer herders of the Russian Arctic with traditional knowledge of tundra ecosystems.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Weather forecasting, reindeer breeding, and permafrost understanding.

indigenousTerritories.name: Malagasy peoples
indigenousTerritories.description: 18 distinct ethnic groups with traditional forest management systems and sacred forest practices.
indigenousTerritories.traditionalKnowledge: Sacred forest (fady) protection, traditional medicine from endemic plants, and sustainable lemur coexistence.

metadata.citation: Dinerstein, E., et al. (2017). An Ecoregion-Based Approach to Protecting Half the Terrestrial Realm. BioScience, 67(6), 534–545.
